com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction

Class AbstractTransactionDelegateFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.bs.transaction.AbstractTransactionDelegateFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionDelegateFactory

    public abstract class AbstractTransactionDelegateFactory
extends java.lang.Object

    A set of factory methods for the instantiable business delegates in the Transaction subsystem. This class is abstract and has a single concrete subclass, TransactionDelegateFactory, that you can modify to override the default behavior in the abstract class or implement an as-yet unimplemented delegate factory. You can, for example, override all the factory methods with a different connection strategy.

    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge

    • Field Detail

      • PROPERTY_FILE

        private static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_FILE
        The fully qualified name of the Transaction subsystem properties file, not including the locale information. This comes from the UML subsystem as the package name concatenated to the subsystem name (the fully qualified subsystem name). The actual file is then in the package with the subsystem name concatenated to the locale name followed by the .properties extension. For example, the subsystem transaction in the com.poesys.accounting.db package has the property file com.poesys.accounting.db.transaction_en_US.properties for the default locale english (US).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getTransactionDelegate

        public static TransactionDelegate getTransactionDelegate()
        Get the TransactionDelegate. The file com.poesys.accounting.db.transaction_en_US.properties supplies the database subsystem for the delegate to use. The method enables caching and constructs the Delegate with the subsystem from the property file. The database and password are set from the database properties file entries for the subsystem. Use this method in contexts where you don't know whether a JNDI server will be available, such as lazy loading contexts or JUnit test cases.
        Returns:
        the delegate

      • getJndiTransactionDelegate

        public static TransactionDelegate getJndiTransactionDelegate()
        Get the TransactionDelegate using the JNDI_DBMS static member initialized from the Transaction.properties file. The system uses the JNDI name to access the data source. Use this method in contexts where you know that the JNDI server will always be available.
        Returns:
        the JNDI delegate
